intro: Senecio perralderianus subsp. perralderianus, commonly known as the Perralderian senecio, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in cool, arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
